questions.question: Question 1: Which of the following is not a measure of location?
questions.explanation:
Percentile is a measure of position. It can be defined as a number that states the percentage of 
observations that fall below any particular score. Measures of location help in summarizing the data by locating its centre or middle. The three 
main measures of location include mean, median and mode. They are also called measures of 
central tendency.
questions.chapter_heading: Descriptive Statistics II - Measures of Location

questions.question: Question 2: The mean can be calculated only if data is on:
questions.explanation:
The mean can be worked out only for quantitative values. Thus, it can be calculated for interval 
or ratio scale data. A dichotomous scale is a type of nominal scale data that can take only two values. Example: Male/ 
Female. For nominal scale data, the preferred measure of central tendency is mode. For ordinal 
scale data, both median and mode can be calculated. Median can be derived from ordinal, interval and ratio data scales. Mode can be derived from all 
scales of data- nominal, ordinal, interval and ratio.
questions.chapter_heading: Descriptive Statistics II - Measures of Location

questions.question:
Question 3: During a school health survey on malnutrition, the children are arranged according to 
ascending order of their heights. Which of the following can be obtained by this 
arrangement?
questions.explanation:
The 50th centile can be obtained when values are arranged in order and the central value is 
picked out. This is the same as the median. In a distribution that has an odd number of elements, the median is the middle value. 812 
Sold by @itachibot In a distribution that has an even number of elements, the median is the average of the middle 
values, i.e., the arithmetic mean of the two middle values. An example of how to calculate the median of an odd and an even number of elements is given 
below. Option C: Geometric mean is obtained by taking the arithmetic mean of values on a logarithmic 
scale. Option D: Mean deviation is a measure of dispersion. The average of deviations from the 
arithmetic mean gives the mean deviation.
questions.chapter_heading: Descriptive Statistics II - Measures of Location

questions.question: Question 4: Which of the following can have more than one value?
questions.explanation:
The mode of a given sample can have more than one value. It is the most frequently occurring 
value in a distribution. For example, in the sample [1, 3, 6, 6, 6, 6, 7, 7, 12, 12, 17], the most repeated value i.e., the mode 
is 6. For the list of data [1, 1, 2, 4, 4], the mode is 1 and 4. Therefore, the mode is not unique. This 
dataset may be said to be bimodal, while a set with more than two modes may be described as 
multimodal. Median can have only one value, obtained by arranging values in order and then picking out the 
central value. In a sample with an even number of elements, median is obtained by taking the 
average of the middle 2 elements. Mean can only have a single value. The harmonic mean is the reciprocal of the arithmetic mean of 
the reciprocals of the data values. The geometric mean is obtained by taking the arithmetic mean 
of values on a logarithmic scale. 813 
Sold by @itachibot

questions.question:
Question 5: While collecting data on which of the following variables would median not be the preferred 
measure of central tendency?
questions.explanation:
Blood pressure usually forms a normal symmetrical distribution for which mean is the preferred 
measure of central tendency. Distributions of survival time, incubation period and health expenses have the probability of 
having extreme values, i.e., outliers. Thus, they form skewed distributions and in such 
cases, median is the preferred measure of central tendency.
questions.chapter_heading: Descriptive Statistics II - Measures of Location

questions.question:
Question 7: You are conducting a study on birth weights in your hospital. Out of 11 births, 5 babies 
weighed over 2.5 kg, one baby weighed 2.5 kg and 5 weighed less than 2.5 kg. What does the 
value 2.5 represent in this distribution?
questions.explanation:
Out of the 11 birth weights, 2.5 kg would represent the middle value or the median. 5 babies weigh 
more than 2.5 kg and 5 less than that. This can be understood from the image below. Option A: Mean or arithmetic mean is the average value. In this case, the mean is the average of 
all the 11 values. It need not be 2.5. Option B: Geometric mean is obtained by taking the arithmetic mean of values on a logarithmic 
scale. 814 
Sold by @itachibot Option D: ˜uartile is a measure of position, where the data is divided into four equal sets. 3/4 of 
the values are below the 3rd quartile reading. Hence, it cannot be the central reading.

questions.question:
Question 8: 807 
Sold by @itachibot You are conducting an epidemiological study on malaria in a town ç. The number of cases 
reported during the last 10 years is given below. What is the most appropriate measure of 
central tendency for this data?
questions.explanation:
In this scenario, median is the preferred measure of central tendency as there are outliers. The value of 5000 is an outlier in the given set, i.e., an observed value which is very distant from 
other observations in the distribution. This indicates the usage of median as the measure of 
central tendency as it is not sensitive to extreme values, unlike the mean. By arranging the data in order: 100, 160, 190, 250, 260, 300, 320, 320, 350, 5000, we get the 
median as (260 + 300) / 2 = 280. Options A and B: Mean is the most affected by the presence of outliers. Mode is the least affected 
by outliers but it is used mainly for measuring the central tendency of nominal data. Option D: Geometric mean can be used for datasets with extreme values but it is not used when 
the values can be zero or negative. In the given scenario, the number of malaria cases reported in 
a town can also have a zero value.

questions.question:
Question 9: During a school health assessment, the mean value of weight for a group of 10 boys was found 
to be 18.2 kg. Žater, it was found that the weight of one of the boys was wrongly recorded as 
2.0 kg instead of 20 kg. What is the true mean weight of the group?
questions.explanation:
The true mean weight of the group is 20 kg. Mean is given as x■ = x / n, where n is the number of elements and x denotes the sum of all the 
elements in the series. In this scenario, the incorrect mean is 18.2, i.e., x / 10 = 18.2, making x = 182. But this is incorrect as one of the 10 weights was wrongly recorded as 2 instead of 20. The corrected x = (Incorrect x – incorrect value) + correct value. The incorrect sum of all elements = 182, incorrect value =2 and the correct value = 20. Thus, the correct sum of all the 10 weights would be, x = (182 – 2) + 20 = 200. From this, the correct mean value of the 10 weights can be given by: x / 10 = 200/ 10 = 20.

questions.question:
Question 11: The smoking history for the past 6 years of a patient with emphysema is given in the table 
below. If a pack has 20 cigarettes, what is the mean, median and mode of the given data?
questions.explanation:
The distribution in this scenario in terms of the number of cigarettes smoked is 5, 10, 10, 10, 20, 
40. The mean here is x/n = 95/6 = 15.833 rounded off to 16. The median here is the central value = average of 3rd and 4th values since the distribution has an 
even number of values. This comes to (10 + 10) / 2 = 10. The mode here is 10 which has a frequency of 3 in the given dataset.

questions.question:
Question 12: While reviewing a data distribution, you find that the highest value of 58 was wrongly 
recorded as 85 and so you correct it. How will this correction change the measures of central 
tendency?

options.a: No change in mean, decreased median
options.b: Decreased mean, no change in median

questions.explanation:
The given change in a dataset would cause a decrease in the mean but the median would remain 
unchanged. The mean is sensitive to every value in the distribution. Since the correct value of 58 is much 
lesser than the wrongly recorded value of 85, the final mean will be decreased compared to the 
earlier recorded value. However, as only the highest value was wrongly recorded, the median i.e., the central value, will 
remain the same.

Question 14: 809 
Sold by @itachibot Which of the following sets of measures of central tendency is likely to match the distribution 
depicted in the given image?
questions.explanation:
The given image is of a right-skewed or positively skewed distribution. So, among the given 
options, the most likely values of mean = 3, median = 2, and mode = 1. We can tell the direction of skew of a distribution by observing the direction of the tail. Here, the 
tail of the distribution is towards the positive direction and thus it is positively skewed 
or right-skewed. In a positively skewed distribution, mean > median > mode. 816 
Sold by @itachibot If the tail of the distribution is towards the negative direction, the distribution would be negatively 
skewed or left-skewed. In such distributions, mode > median > mean.

questions.question:
Question 15: You are conducting a study on blood pressure in a population. The systolic blood pressure 
values have a mean of 130 mmHg, a median of 140 mmHg and mode of 160 mmHg. What 
type of distribution is this?
questions.explanation:
This is a unimodal negatively skewed distribution. In this scenario, the mean of 130 mmHg is less than the median of 140 mmHg which is less than 
mode of 160mmHg. Since mean<median<mode, this is an asymmetrical negatively skewed or 
left-skewed distribution. It is a unimodal distribution as there is only a single value for mode. In a symmetrical distribution, the mean = median = mode. In a positively skewed distribution, mean > median > mode.
questions.chapter_heading: Descriptive Statistics II - Measures of Location

questions.question: Question 16: The mean of a dataset is 2 and the median is 3. What is the mode?
questions.explanation:
As the mean  median, this is an asymmetric distribution and so we can use the formula: Mode = 3 median - 2 mean. Using the given values, mode = (3x3) – (2x2) = 9 – 4 = 5. A distribution is termed symmetric when the mean, median and mode coincide i.e., mean= 
median= mode.
questions.chapter_heading: Descriptive Statistics II - Measures of Location

questions.question:
Question 17: Study A(red) and Study B(blue) done in a given population yields two different distribution 
curves as shown below. Comparing both the curves, which of the following will be true?
questions.explanation:
On comparing the 2 graphs, we can say mean=median for both study A and B but the mode is 
different. Study A is a unimodal symmetrical distribution, so mean=median=mode. Study B is a bimodal distribution. Here, mean=median, but the curve has two highest points, 
therefore it has 2 modes. 817
